newsitem.title: USA: ComEd Ill. Dresden 2 nuke fully back - NRC.
newsitem.headline: ComEd Ill. Dresden 2 nuke fully back - NRC.

text.p: Commonwealth Edison Co's (ComEd) 794 megawatt (MW) Dresden 2 nuclear power plant in Morris, Ill., was back at full power late Tuesday, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said Wednesday.
ComEd reduced electricity output at the Morris, Ill., unit last weekend to perform maintenance and testing on its main steam isolation valves.
The neighboring 794 MW Dresden 3 was producing at 77 percent of capacity ahead of its scheduled refueling outage in March 1997, the NRC said in its daily status report.
Commonwealth Edison, a subsidiary of Unicom Corp, is the operator and sole owner of the Dresden units.
